title: Plagues of Locusts and Darkness
summary: Exodus 10 tells of two more plagues: locusts devour whatâ€™s left after the hail, and thick darkness covers Egypt for three days. Pharaoh briefly offers compromise but still refuses full obedience.

faq.question: What made the plague of darkness unique?
faq.answer: It was a tangible darkness for three days, but the Israelites still had light.

faq.question: Did Pharaoh agree to let the people go?
faq.answer: He offered partial compromises, but not full release to worship, so the plagues continued.
